Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.0; en-US; rv:1.9.2.15) Gecko/20110303 BTRS28059 Firefox/3.6.15

In menu Options->General->downloads->Save files to... the users sets his/her prefered location for file downloads. In case that the user-defined location is not available (for example, when it points to an external USB memory), the software automatically changes the user-defined settings. This is totally wrong. The software should NEVER change user settings. The only thing that the software can do is temporarily change the download location to another location, until the user-defined location is available again.
    

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Go to Options->General->downloads->Save files to... 
2. Use "Browse" to set the location to a directory which is located on an external USB memory (For example: drive H:)
3. Remove the external USB memory device.
4. Check the settings at Options->General->downloads->Save files to...
Actual Results:  
The settings in Options->General->downloads->Save files to... were changed by the software to its default location (C:\Users\USERNAME\Downloads).


Expected Results:  
The settings in Options->General->downloads->Save files to... should not change. User settings are for the user and not for the software.


Whenever the user-defined location is not available, the software can temporarily save new files to its default location. Whenever the user-defined location is available again, the files will be downloaded as the user wished.
